article_title: How Much Should Taxpayers Spend To Give Uninsured People 16 Days of Healthy Life?

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: Should Uncle Sam spend $250,000 to provide uninsured people with 1 healthy year of life? That’s the question I posed recently at The Agenda. My calculations were based on the results from the recent study Changes in Mortality After Massachusetts Health Care Reform which purported to show that the Massachusetts reform law saved lives: 1 death avoided for every 830 uninsured people given coverage. I tried to point out that even if the Massachusetts results could be extrapolated directly to Obamacare, the cost to achieve such mortality reductions likely would exceed conventionally accepted thresholds of how much it was worth spending to give people 1 added year of healthy life.
